intro: Chaetanthera pratensis, commonly known as the meadow chaetanthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks. The plant features slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, feathery appearance. It is noted for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
